title: Will using a bluetooth headphone cause a damage to my head? - Quora

response.answer_text: Obviously, a Bluetooth headphone cannot cause physical damage to the head. At least, it could be a headache caused by a heavy and tight headband, which also cannot bend. However, we can look at it from another perspective - can it cause cancer? Let’s make things clear. Does a Bluetooth headphones release radiation? To understand this, you should know how it works. Wireless headsets are radio-transmitting accessories that are connected to your device via Bluetooth. The latter is a radio frequency radiation that operates by sending data over a limited distance through the air. Not to be confused with the radiation from a mobile phone that transmits signals through a long distance. So, the radiofrequency from Bluetooth headphones has a lower power and radiation release, which is not that strong to give rise to tumor. Thus, the Federal Communications Commission states that the damage to a head caused by using wireless Bluetooth headphones has never been scientifically found and proven, nor its relation to cancer or other health issues. In the meantime, the World Health Organization suggests that Bluetooth headphones and mobile phones might be a reason for a tumor due to the increase of cases with a tumor in particular part of the head. And this is where we should slow down to make things even clearer. Health concerns Where are the headphones usually placed? Obviously, it’s in or over your ears. It can lead to a human brain damage, particularly to neuronal and irrevocable DNA one, which booms the threat of cancer. Therefore, these are just indirect suggestions that radiation from headsets and mobile devices is somehow related to brain issues. But they cannot be considered as established scientific proof. So, Bluetooth headphones rather do not cause damage to your head. Keep on reading. There’s something more about it. Suggesting that the radiation of EMF impacts on your head and brains, yet the ability of Bluetooth from headsets to do harm depends on its capacity to influence DNA and cells. The radiation needs to fracture the DNA molecular bonds to the moment when the data is changed prior to producing cancer in a cell. This can only happen when the radiation is ionizing, which exiles electrons from molecules and atoms. Thus, the characteristics of the DNA atoms are shifted, and its molecule bonds are fractured, the cells are trying to reproduce, and tumor cells can theoretically start growing. But here’s the truth - Bluetooth is non-ionizing radiation that cannot fracture bonds of molecules and atoms in the DNA. As a result, it doesn’t bring about any tumor cells growing into cancer. The Internet “spreads rumors” about potential risks, such as Bluetooth ruins nerve cells or microwaves the brain. But none of them are true. And now you know why. Finally, the American Cancer Society says that between you and a wireless device there’s a big distance, which decreases the amount of radiofrequency waves that reach your head.

In the beginning, it was claimed that cellphones cause brain cancer, then it was claimed that WiFi causes tissue damage, etc. Such claims make absolutely no sense and have thus been proven wrong by several academic research projects. In summary: personal wireless technologies that exist today do NOT adversely affect human health. If you think otherwise, then perhaps you should stop using electricity altogether as it has been proven that it causes tens of thousands of deaths each year.
